factoid: Everyone laughed a great deal.
Everyone at the head of the table seemed to be in high spirits and under the influence of a variety of exciting sensations.
Pierre and Hélène sat silently side by side almost at the bottom of the table.
Pierre and Hélène had a suppressed smile brightening both their faces.
Pierre and Hélène's smile had nothing to do with Sergéy Kuzmích.
Pierre and Hélène's smile was a smile of bashfulness at their own feelings.
Everyone else laughed, talked, and joked.
Everyone else enjoyed their Rhine wine, sauté, and ices.
Everyone else avoided looking at the young couple.
Everyone else seemed heedless and unobservant of the young couple.
By the occasional glances they gave, one could feel that the story about Sergéy Kuzmích, the laughter, and the food were all a pretense.
By the occasional glances they gave, one could feel that the whole attention of that company was directed to Pierre and Hélène.
Prince Vasíli mimicked the sobbing of Sergéy Kuzmích.
Prince Vasíli's eyes glanced toward his daughter.
Prince Vasíli laughed.
Prince Vasíli's expression on his face clearly said: "Yes… it's getting on, it will all be settled today."
Anna Pávlovna threatened Prince Vasíli on behalf of Vyazmítinov.
Anna Pávlovna's eyes glanced at Pierre for an instant.
Prince Vasíli read a congratulation about his future son‑in‑law and his daughter's happiness.
The old princess sighed sadly.
The old princess offered some wine to the old lady next to her.
The old princess glanced angrily at her daughter.

The old princess's sigh seemed to say: "Yes, there's nothing left for you and me but to sip sweet wine, my dear, now that the time has come for these young ones to be thus boldly, provocatively happy."
A diplomatist thought: "And what nonsense all this is that I am saying!"
A diplomatist glanced at the happy faces of the lovers.
A diplomatist thought: "That's happiness!"
The simple feeling of attraction between Pierre and Hélène entered the society.
The human feeling dominated everything else.
The human feeling surged above all their affected chatter.
Jests fell flat.
News was not interesting.
The animation was evidently forced.
The guests seemed to feel this.
The footmen waiting at the table seemed to feel this.
The footmen forgot their duties as they looked at the beautiful Hélène with her radiant face.
The footmen forgot their duties as they looked at the red, broad, and happy though uneasy face of Pierre.
The light of the candles seemed to be focused on the faces of Pierre and Hélène.
Pierre felt that he was the center of it all.
Pierre was pleased by feeling like the center.
Pierre was embarrassed by feeling like the center.
Pierre was entirely absorbed in some occupation.
Pierre did not see anything clearly.
Pierre did not hear anything clearly.
Pierre did not understand anything clearly.
Detached ideas and impressions from the world of reality shot unexpectedly through Pierre's mind.
Pierre thought: "So it is all finished!"
Pierre thought: "Now I know that it will inevitably come about because of everyone."
Pierre thought: "They are all expecting it and are sure it will happen."
Pierre thought: "I cannot disappoint them."
Pierre thought: "I do not know how it will be, but it will certainly happen."
Pierre glanced at the dazzling shoulders close to his eyes.
Pierre felt ashamed of not knowing what.
Pierre felt it was awkward to attract everyone's attention.
Pierre felt it was awkward to be considered a lucky man.
Pierre had a plain face.
Pierre was looked on as a sort of Paris possessed of a Helen.
Pierre consoled himself: "But no doubt it always is and must be so!"
Pierre thought: "What have I done to bring it about?"
Pierre thought: "How did it begin?"
Pierre thought: "I traveled from Moscow with Prince Vasíli."
Pierre thought: "Then there was nothing."
Pierre thought: "So why should I not stay at his house?"
Pierre thought: "Then I played cards with her."
Pierre thought: "I picked up her reticule and drove out with her."
Pierre suddenly felt that it was not Hélène but he was so unusually beautiful.
Pierre felt that this was why everyone looked at him.
Pierre felt flattered by this general admiration.
Pierre expanded his chest, raised his head, and rejoiced at his good fortune.
Pierre suddenly heard a familiar voice repeating something to him a second time.
Pierre did not understand what was said.
